p: High-profile global HIV targets were first defined in the 2000 MDGs. The MDGs did not specify quantitative targets, stating an aim to ‘halt and reverse’ the epidemic, without defining this precisely [ 75]. The Declaration of Commitment on HIV/AIDS of 2001 set out more detailed time-bound goals and targets [ 76], with an emphasis on transparency, accountability, and ongoing reporting that owes much to concerted, determined civil society activism [ 77]. Progress against the 2001 Declaration’s targets was systematically reported in 2006 [ 78], demonstrating that only the target on increasing HIV/AIDS funding for low- and middle-income countries (LMICs) had been achieved, while there were significant gaps in progress towards the prevention and epidemiological targets ( Table 3).
